path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Callisto_Network/Fantom Token (FTM) Smart Contract Audit Report by Callisto Network.md

findings.title: The smart contract is susceptible to double withdrawal attacks.
findings.description: The contract allows multiple withdrawals of the same funds.

findings.title: The contract lacks a transaction handling mechanism.
findings.description: The smart contract does not have an anomaly detection algorithm to monitor and respond to unusual activities, which can lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Automated Anomaly Detection System: Not Implemented
findings.description: Establishing a simple anomaly detection algorithm to monitor and respond to unusual activities is advised.

findings.title: Multi-signature Owner Account:
findings.description: A multi-signature setup for owner accounts is recommended for additional security layers.

findings.title: Standard ERC20-Related Issues: Implemented
findings.description: Smart contracts can inadvertently receive ERC20-token deposits without the ability to reject them, so it's recommended to incorporate a function that allows for the extraction of any unintended tokens from the contract.

findings.title: Crosschain Address Collisions:
findings.description: Transactions can be mistakenly sent to a contract's address on a different chain (ETH, ETC, CLO, etc.).
